phrases.phrase: Renders a section displaying the latest articles in the activity summary email. Articles can be filtered on various criteria.
Renders a section displaying the latest article comments in the activity summary email.
Renders a section displaying the latest article reviews in the activity summary email.
AMS Article view: Above article content
AMS Article view: Below article content
AMS Series view: Above article list
AMS Series view: Below article list
Advertising position above the article content when viewing an article.
Advertising position below the article content when viewing an article.
Advertising position above the article list when viewing a series.
Advertising position below the article list when viewing a series.
Adds a new article to a watched category
Mentions you in a article comment
Adds a new page to a watched article
Mentions you in a article review
Adds a new article to a watched series
AMS: Failed Original Source Url check
AMS: Cache article management system statistics
BB code for displaying articles, article pages and series
Article comment removed from public view (reason: {reason})
Article page removed from public view (reason: {reason})
Article review removed from public view (reason: {reason})
Article list layout type (author pages)
Published in the last X days
Updated in the last X days
Automatically unfeature any "featured" articles older than x days.
Default featured map marker icon url
Use the "About me" data for the "About author" block if the "About article author" is empty
Exclude featured articles from articles listing on index and category pages
Exclude featured series from series listing on the series index page.
Include image attachments from comments in the gallery (Own tab)
Include article page image attachments in the image gallery (Own tab)
Include image attachments from posts in the gallery (Own tab)
Include reviews image attachments in the image gallery (Own tab)
Show Points of Interest on Category maps
Enable 'View full article' links on multi page articles
Article read time is based on the average reading speed of an adult (roughly 265 words per minute).
List the file extensions that are allowed to be uploaded to articles. Use spaces or line break between extensions.

Provide the maximum article attachment file size in kilobytes (KB). Attachments over this size will be rejected.

Important Note: The option "Maximum attachments per article" has been removed and is now set via AMS Permissions!
When an article is deleted, take this action with any automatically created thread associated with the article.

Choose the layout type you want to use to display articles on ams index, category pages and other various pages with article listings. Note: Individual category pages can override this setting and use a different layout type.

Important Note: If the viewing user does not have permission to view ams article attachments, the listing page will be rendered in List View layout type regardless of this option setting (applies to category options and widget options as well).
The maximum number of characters that can be in an article. This includes BB code. Note: Use 0 to disable the limit.
The number of articles that will be listed per page on various pages with article listings that use the list view layout type.
The number of articles that will be listed per page on various pages with article listings that use the article view layout type.
The number of articles that will be listed per page on various pages with article listings that use the grid view layout type.
The number of articles that will be listed per page on various pages with article listings that use the tile view layout type.
Allows you to set the display order of the [Search articles] tab.
The maximum number of articles to display in the "More from [author name]" block. Use 0 to disable this block.

Choose the layout type you want to use to display articles on ams author pages (includes the Articles Tab on member profiles) with article listings.

Important Note: If the viewing user does not have permission to view ams article attachments, the listing page will be rendered in List View layout type regardless of this option setting (applies to article listings throughout AMS to include Widgets).
When enabled, articles will be automatically featured based on selected categories and criteria.
Select the categories from which articles will be featured automatically.

Articles that have at least X comments.
use -1 to ignore

If enabled, the criteria above will be exclusive (OR), rather than inclusive (AND).
Exclusive: 300 views OR a reaction score of 50 OR an average rating of 4 OR 25 comments
Inclusive: 300 views AND a reaction score of 50 AND an average rating of 4 AND 25 comments
Articles that have been published within the last x days

Articles that have a rating average of at least X.
use -1 to ignore

Articles that have a reaction score of at least X.
use -1 to ignore
Articles that have been updated within the last x days

Select the user groups from which authors articles will be featured automatically

Note: Select (none) to disable this criteria. If (none) is selected, even with other user groups selected, the system will consider this criteria disabled!

Articles that have at least X views.
use -1 to ignore
If enabled, will automatically unfeature any featured articles that are older than x days (from the date the article was featured).
The maximum number of articles to display in the "More in [category name]" block. Use 0 to disable this block.
List the file extensions that are allowed to be uploaded to comments. Use spaces or line break between extensions.
Provide the maximum comment attachment file size in kilobytes (KB). Attachments over this size will be rejected.
The maximum number of characters that can be in an article comment. This includes BB code. Use 0 to disable the limit.
When enabled, will display share icons below the article.
If the "About article author" is empty, this will attempt to use the "About me" data from the members profile for the "About author" block.
When enabled, members will be able to set an author name (like their real name) in the account details, which will replace their username on any of their articles.
If enabled, members will be able to browse an alphabetical list of authors. This can have performance implications with a large number of authors.
When enabled, will remove duplicate articles from the AMS Index and Category pages that are already being fetched for the featured articles carousel or grid block.
When enabled, will remove duplicate series from the Series Index page that are already being fetched for the featured series carousel.

When enabled, the Category navigation block will expand the entire category tree.

Note: If you wish to control expanding category navigation on a per category level, do not set this option as this option overrides the per category option. Instead, use the per category option instead!
Choose the display type you want to use to display featured articles on ams index, category pages and other various pages with article listings.

The number of featured articles you want to fetch for display in the featured articles carousel on AMS index and AMS category pages. Use 0 to disable the featured articles carousel or grid block. Note: The featured grid block is limited to displaying 3 articles.
The number of featured series you want to fetch for display in the featured series carousel on AMS Series index page. Use 0 to disable the featured series carousel.
Controls where the collection of uploaded file attachments will be displayed
Controls the display type (single block or multiple blocks) of the image gallery when set to "Own tab".
Controls where the collection of uploaded images will be displayed
Input your Google Maps Embed API Key here. Instructions on generating and retrieving your Google Maps Embed API key can be found here.
Input your Google Maps Geocoding API Key here. Instructions on generating and retrieving your Google Maps Geocoding API key can be found here.
Input your Google Maps JavaScript API Key here. Instructions on generating and retrieving your Google Maps JavaScript API key can be found here.

This option allows you to include comments image attachments from the comments section in the ams image gallery. This option is only available when the 'Image gallery location' option is set to "Own tab".
This option allows you to include article page image attachments in the image gallery. This option is only available when the 'Image gallery location' option is set to "Own tab".

This option allows you to include posts image attachments from the associated discussion thread, in the ams image gallery. This option is only available when the 'Image gallery location' option is set to "Own tab".
This option allows you to include reviews image attachments in the image gallery. This option is only available when the 'Image gallery location' option is set to "Own tab".

Choose the type of Home Page that you want to use for AMS.
  • Standard = Index of all articles in a filterable listing.
  • Modular = Blank page with Main, Sidenav and Sidebar Widget Locations

This is the number of days old that a review can be in order for it to be fetched. Reviews that are older than the cutoff date will not be displayed. Leave this option set to 0 to bypass the cut off date.
Users that do not have the permission to view full articles will only see this number of characters of the article. Note: This setting also applies to Article view layout.
When viewing various pages with article listings, this will be the default sort order that is set.
When enabled, will localize various google maps (both Embed API generated and JS API generated) throughout AMS, based on XF language settings for the viewing user.
Controls how the location data will be displayed when viewing an article

When enabled, the MarkerClustererPlus library used in combination with the Maps JavaScript API, will combine map markers of close proximity to one another into clusters to simplify the display of markers on the map at various zoom levels.
Enter a meta description for your Article Management System Home Page. This will be placed inside the meta description tag on the AMS Index page, so avoid using HTML.
If a review is entered, it will not be accepted unless it is at least this long. If a review is not required, this setting will be ignored if no review is entered.

When the "Display location" above is set to "Below article", you can choose the layout type you want to use to display articles in the "More from [author]" block.

Important Note: If the viewing user does not have permission to view ams article attachments, the more from author block will be rendered in List View layout type regardless of this option setting.
Controls where the "More from [author name]" block will be displayed

When the "Display location" above is set to "Below article", you can choose the layout type you want to use to display articles in the "More in [category name]" block.

Important Note: If the viewing user does not have permission to view ams article attachments, the more in category block will be rendered in List View layout type regardless of this option setting.
Controls where the More in [category name] block will be displayed
The style selected here will be displayed on all ams pages instead of the default style.
The maximum number of recent reviews to display on the main article view page. Note: Use 0 to disable this block.
List the file extensions that are allowed to be uploaded to reviews. Use spaces or line break between extensions.
Provide the maximum review attachment file size in kilobytes (KB). Attachments over this size will be rejected.
The maximum number of characters that can be in an article review. This includes BB code. Use 0 to disable the limit.
The number of articles that will be listed per page on a series.
The maximum number of characters that can be in the series details. This includes BB code. Note: Use 0 to disable the limit.
The number of series that will be listed per page on series index and other various pages with series listings.

When enabled, will include points of interest on Category maps (this is default standard with google maps). Disable this option if you want to "clean up" the map from looking cluttered.
Note: This does not apply to individual article maps.
When enabled, signatures will display on comments just like they do on posts.
The number of characters of the article preview to display on the article view layout type.
The number of characters of the article preview to display on the featured articles carousel.
The number of characters of the article preview to display on the grid view layout type.
The number of characters of the article preview to display on the list view layout type.
If enabled, the count of unread articles will display above the "Articles" navigation tab.

Scheduled articles that will be published within X amount of days, will be displayed in the Upcoming articles block in the Articles Queue. Default is set at 14, which means articles that are scheduled to be published within the next 14 days will be displayed as Upcoming Articles.
When enabled, will add "View full article" links to various navigation elements on a multi page article, allowing the viewing user to view the full article on a single page.
Options that control the article management system add-on.
AMS: Convert thread to ams article
Ban users from posting comments/ratings on articles
Time limit on editing/deleting own articles (minutes)
Time limit on editing/deleting own comments (minutes)
Time limit on editing/deleting own reviews (minutes)
Time limit on editing/deleting own series (minutes)
Lock / unlock comments for own articles
Lock / unlock ratings for own articles
Manage tags by others for own articles
Manage tags by others in own series
Manage seo options for own articles
Reply to reviews for own articles
Self join contributors team on any article within categories that allow self join contributors team
Set author rating for own articles
Article Management System: Article moderator permissions
Article Management System: Comment moderator permissions
Article Management System: Rate/Review moderator permissions
Article Management System: Series moderator permissions
The elements selected here will be displayed on the Article View Layout.
The elements selected here will be displayed on widgets created with the AMS: Latest articles widget definition and display style "Full - Carousel"
This setting allows you to choose whether to show 1 article at a time or 2 articles at a time.
The elements selected here will be displayed on widgets created with the AMS: Featured or Latest articles widget definition and display style "Simple - Carousel"
The elements selected here will be displayed on the Latest Articles Grid Block.
The elements selected here will be displayed on the Featured Articles Grid Block.
The elements selected here will be displayed on the Featured Carousel on AMS Index, AMS Category pages and AMS Featured Carousel Widgets.
This setting allows you to choose whether to show 1 article at a time or 2 articles at a time.
The elements selected here will be displayed on the Grid View Layout.
The elements selected here will be displayed on the List View Layout.
Enable/disable the "Share this article" block and choose which additional elements display in the block.
The elements selected here will be displayed on the Tile View Layout.
A number of properties to control the appearance of XenAddons Article Management System
Displays the specified article page poll in a widget.
Displays the specified poll in a widget.
Displays various article management system statistics.
Displays a map with markers for articles with location data.
Displays the article management system category navigation.
Displays featured articles from the article management system.
Displays featured series from the article management system.
Displays the latest article management system articles.
Displays the latest article management system comments.
Displays the latest article management system series.
Displays the specified series poll in a widget.
AMS Series list: Above series list
AMS Series list: Below series list
AMS Series view: Above article list
AMS Series view: Below article list
A position in the main content area of the article view, above the article container. Widget templates rendered in this position can use the current article entity in the {$context.article} param.
A position in the main content area of the article view, below the article container. Widget templates rendered in this position can use the current article entity in the {$context.article} param.
A position inside the main content area of the category page above the articles list.
A position inside the main content area of the category page below the articles list.
Displays inside the sidebar on category pages. Widget templates rendered in this position can use the current category entity in the {$context.category} param.
Displays inside the side navigation on ategory pages. Widget templates rendered in this position can use the current category entity in the {$context.category} param.
A position inside the main content area of the index page above the articles list.
A position inside the main content area of the index page below the articles list.
Displays inside the sidebar on the index page.
Displays inside the side navigation on the index page.
Displays inside the main column on the modular index page, so can support larger widgets.
Displays inside the sidebar on the modular index page.
Displays inside the sidenav on the modular index page.
A position inside the main content area of the ams series list page above the series list.
A position inside the main content area of the ams series list page below the series list.
Displays inside the sidebar on the ams series list page.
A position in the main content area of the series view, above the article list. Widget templates rendered in this position can use the current series entity in the {$context.series} param.
A position in the main content area of the series view, below the article list. Widget templates rendered in this position can use the current series entity in the {$context.series} param.
A cover image or content image
This information will display in the "About author" block on articles that you create.
If no categories are explicitly selected, this widget will pull from all categories unless used within an AMS category. In this case, the content will be limited to that category and descendents.
All comments and reviews from the other articles will be merged into this article.
All selected articles are already in the destination category. Please select another category.
When enabled, users will have the option to leave an anonymous review.
This option allows Articles to be created in this category. Disabling this option does not prevent existing articles from being moved into this category.
When enabled, this option allows the article author to set an author rating when creating or editing the article. This rating is separate from user ratings.

This option allows comments for articles in this category. This option can be enabled/disabled at any time and only effects articles within this specific category. Important note: Comment Permissions determine whether or not the viewing user can view/post comments.
This option allows article authors (and moderators) with appropriate permissions, to add contributors and or co-authors, to articles within this category.

When this option is enabled, a location field will be available on the article create/edit form. This location field will be used to display a link in the header or Information sidebar block that when clicked on will open up a Google map to the location.
This option allows authors to add original source data to their articles
When this option is enabled, a poll can be added to articles within this category.
When enabled, users will be able to input pros and cons when submitting a review for an article.
When enabled, users with the appropriate permissions will be able to rate and or review articles within this category.
When enabled, members with the appropriate permissions can vote on reviews.
Allows members with the appropriate permissions to self join the contributor team for a given article in this category.
The articles you have selected are located in more than one category. Each article will only be updated if the chosen prefix is valid in its category.
Article author not in user groups

When enabled, will display the cover image (if set), above the article.

Note: After creating the article, you can use the "Set cover image" function in the more options to choose a specific uploaded image to use as the article cover image. You can also set a caption for the cover image at the same time.

When enabled, will display the cover image (if set), above the article.

Note: You can use the "Set cover image" function in the more options to choose a specific uploaded image to use as the article cover image. You can also set a caption for the cover image at the same time.
Article has at least X comments
Article has at least X rating average
Article has at least X reaction score
Article has at least X views
This thread is for the general discussion of the {term} [url={article_link}][plain]{title}[/plain][/url]. Please add to the discussion here.
Article was published no more than X days ago
Article was updated no more than X days ago
{article} - New article posted by watched author
{articleTitle} posted in article category {categoryTitle}
The article {title} was reassigned to you.
The articles author name replaces the xf username being displayed on articles.
A full size view, displaying articles in a grid block container (best used with random sort order). This display style is not designed for use in sidebar or sidenav positions.
This action will associate an existing discussion thread with this article.
Associate with an existing discussion thread
Automatically post in the article thread on article deletion

Users will be prompted to post a new article in this category using one of the prompts selected here. The prompt appears in the article title input box, before a title is entered. If no prompts are selected, the default prompt phrase (ams_article_prompt.default) is used.
Add a specific URL that you want the block title to link to. Leaving this blank will link to "New Articles"
Can not change date into the future.
Can not set comment date older than the article publish date.
Can not set review date older than the article publish date
You can not update your rating or review once the author has responded.
A carousel view, displaying articles in a full carousel style slider. This display style is not designed for use in sidebar or sidenav positions.

This content is optional and is used to display custom content on the first page of a category before the listing of articles.

You may use HTML. The text (or HTML) you insert here must be valid within a <p> tag.
The type of content being published for this category, eg Poem, Guide, Book, How To, Owners Manual, Interview etc etc etc. Note: If you leave this blank, the generic term "Article" will be used.
This title is optional and will be used to generate a Title bar for the category content. If you leave the title blank, the category content will not have a title bar.
Category does not allow new articles to be added.
Comment on article {articleTitle} by {userName}
A comment on the article {title} was reassigned to you.
When enabled, registered users or guests with appropriate permissions may comment on this article.
When enabled, allows other members of the community to add their own article(s) to this series.
Will display the article page cover image caption (if set), below the article page cover image that displays above the article page.
Will display the cover image caption (if set), below the cover image that displays above the article.
Custom featured map marker icon url
This allows you to override the default featured map marker and display a custom featured map marker for featured articles in this category.
This allows you to override the default map marker and display a custom map marker for articles in this category.
You may specify an article prefix to be automatically selected when visitors create new articles in this category. The selected prefix must also be selected in the 'Available prefixes' list above.

This allows you to preset one or more tags on the add article form for aritcle created within this category. Note: These tags are not force added, the member creating the article can remove then prior to creating the new article.
Associated discussion thread reply count between
When enabled, will display the about author block below the article. You must have the about author data entered via your user account (Account details >> About Author)
Display articles on the ams index page

When enabled, articles from this category will be displayed on the AMS Index Page (if viewable by the viewing user).

Note: When disabled, articles from this category will still be displayed on Category Pages and other various AMS pages, Widgets etc that display articles.
Display as map below article (requires API Key)
Display as map in own tab (requires API Key)
Display as map in sidebar block (requires API Key)
When enabled, will display the cover image (if set), above the article.
Display cover image above article page
When enabled, will display the article page cover image (if set), above the article page.
When enabled, this field will be displayed with the article information on various article listing pages
Display as link in article information block

When this option is enabled, some location data (City, State, Country) will be displayed on listing pages using List View, Grid View, Article View and Carousel layouts. You can choose a specific display type below.
When enabled, will display the article page Username/Author name and Create date below the Article Page Title. Note: Should only be used in cases where the page author is not the article author.
Display type: City, State (Mountain View, California)
Display type: City, State, Country (Mountain View, California, United States)
Display type: City, State, Country short (Mountain View, California, US)
Display type: City, State short (Mountain View, CA)
Display type: City, State short, Country short (Mountain View, CA, US)
Display type: Formatted address (1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043)
You do not have permission to view the full content of this article.
You do not have permission to view the full content of this {term}.
Do not include image attachments from comments
Do not include image attachments from posts
This page is currently in draft and not visible publicly.
This option requires a Google Maps Geocoding API Key and a Google Maps JavaScript API Key. These API Keys must be set in the AMS Map Options!
This option requires a Google Maps Geocoding API Key and a Google Maps JavaScript API Key. These API Keys must be set in the AMS Map Options!
Checking this option will exclude any featured articles from being fetched for this widget.
Checking this option will exclude any featured series from being fetched for this widget.
Existing discussion thread is already associated with another piece of content.

When enabled, this category will be expanded on the Category Navigation Block (one sub level only).

Note: If you want the entire category tree for this specific category to be exapanded, you will need to edit each sub category in the trees and set this option.
Explain why you're giving this rating. Reviews which are not constructive may be removed without notice.
A carousel view, displaying series items in a full carousel style slider. This display style is not designed for use in sidebar or sidenav positions.
From author, co-authors and contributors only
A full size view, displaying as a standard article list using article view layout type. This display style is not designed for use in sidebar or sidenav positions.
A full size view, displaying as a standard article list using grid view layout type. This display style is not designed for use in sidebar or sidenav positions.
A full size view, displaying as a standard article list using list view layout type. This display style is not designed for use in sidebar or sidenav positions.
A full size view, displaying as a standard article list using tile view layout type. This display style is not designed for use in sidebar or sidenav positions.
A full size view, displaying as a standard series list using list view layout type. This display style is not designed for use in sidebar or sidenav positions.
When enabled, the title of the field will not be displayed on the article, only the field content.
If enabled, only featured articles will be fetched.
If selected, whenever an article in this category is created, a thread will be posted in this forum. Only "general discussion" type forums may be selected.
If selected, only staff will be able to see who wrote this review.
If selected, a post will be made automatically on the creator's behalf explaining that the article is no longer available.
If selected, users will be required to select a prefix when creating or editing an article. This will not be enforced for moderators.
If specified, all visitors will view this category and its contents using the selected style, regardless of their personal style preference.

This is the number of days old that a article can be in order for it to be fetched. Articles that are older than the cutoff date will not be fetch. Leave this option set to 0 to bypass the cut off date.
Specify the maximum number of article comments that should be shown in this widget.

This is the number of days old that a review can be in order for it to be fetched. Reviews that are older than the cutoff date will not be displayed. Leave this option set to 0 to bypass the cut off date.
Specify the maximum number of reviews that should be shown in this widget.

If sorting by "Create date", this is the number of days old that a series can be in order for it to be fetched. Series that are older than the cutoff date will not be fetch.

If sorting by any of the other sort orders, this is the number of days old that the Last Series Part can be in order for it to be fetched. Series where the Last Series Part is older than the cutoff date will not be fetch.

Leave this option set to 0 to bypass the cut off date.

Enter the address of the location associated with your article if you wish to link to a google map.
eg 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043

Enter the address of the location associated with your article.
eg 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043
The maximum allowed number of contributors/co-authors that can be set for a given article within this category.
The maximum amount of series to fetch and display in this widget.
Member submitted images via discussion thread posts
Members who have reacted to comment by {user}
Members who have reacted to page '{title}' by {user}
Members who have reacted to review by {user}
The title used in the title tag. A meta title, also known as a title tag, refers to the text that is displayed on search engine result pages and browser tabs to indicate the topic of a webpage.
This allows you to require users to enter at least this many tags when adding articles or editing tags on existing articles.
The minimum required series articles. Note: set to 0 to disable this option.
If the selected articles(s) have any prefixes applied which are not valid in the selected category, those prefixes will be removed.
The new article discussion thread must be a standard discussion thread.
New page added to watched article

No articles have been added yet.

Note that the article author will see this alert even if they can no longer view their article.
Notify article author of this action
Notify the current and new owners of this action.
Notify members watching the destination category
The Open Graph / Twitter title used on social media (Facebook, Twitter etc).
Only display within selected categories (rather than including child categories)
Only visible state articles can be added to a series. The current state of the article you are attempting to add is '{state}'
Admin, edit the phrase 'xa_ams_original_source_explain' to remove this text and add your own text explanation on how to use the original source fields.
The FULL URL to the external original source site eg https://originalsourcewebsite.com
Override the ams option 'Article list default sort order'
This option allows you to override the ams option 'Article list default sort order' and set a different article list default sort order for this category.
Override ams option 'Article list layout type'

This option allows you to override the ams option 'Article list layout type' and set a different article list layout type for this category.

Important Note: If the viewing user does not have permission to view ams article attachments, the listing page will be rendered in List View layout type regardless of this option setting.

This optional overview page nav title is for use with the multipage pagination function where a short version of the overview page title is more appropriate. Leave this blank to use the full overview page title.

This optional title is for use with the multipage page articles. It replaces the term "overview" which is used to designate the first page of a multi page article. The title is used in multi page navigation, table of contents and page header.
This optional setting is used to add indents to page titles in the multi page navigation (to simulate hierarchy)
This optional title is for use with the multi-page pagination function where a short version of the title is more appropriate. Leave this blank to use the full page title.
A page {page} on the article {article} was reassigned to you.
Please confirm that you want to associate an existing discussion thread with this article.
Please confirm that you want to lock comments on
Please confirm that you want to lock ratings on
Please confirm that you want to publish the following article now
Please confirm that you want to unassociate discussion thread from this article.
Please confirm that you want to unlock comments on
Please confirm that you want to unlock ratings on
Please provide a review with your rating.
Send Alerts and Emails to members that are watching this article. If unchecked, will save as a Silent Edit.
The prefix will only be applied if it is valid for the category the article is in or is being moved to.

Provide a brief summary of your article for search engines.

A meta description can influence the decision of the searcher as to whether they want to click through on your article from search results or not. The more descriptive, attractive and relevant the description, the more likely someone will click through.

Provide a brief summary of your article page for search engines.

A meta description can influence the decision of the searcher as to whether they want to click through on your article page from search results or not. The more descriptive, attractive and relevant the description, the more likely someone will click through.

Provide a brief summary of your category for search engines.

A meta description can influence the decision of the searcher as to whether they want to click through on your category from search results or not. The more descriptive, attractive and relevant the description, the more likely someone will click through.

Provide a brief summary of your series for search engines.

A meta description can influence the decision of the searcher as to whether they want to click through on your series from search results or not. The more descriptive, attractive and relevant the description, the more likely someone will click through.

Provide a very brief description of your article.

Note: Leave this blank to use a snippet from the article as the description.

Provide a very brief description of your article page.

When this option is enabled, an image attachment must be uploaded to the article, in order for the article to be saved when creating a new article or editing an existing article.

When this option is enabled, a location must be included when posting or editing articles in this category.

Enabling this will require the the original source fields to be filled in when creating or editing an article in this category. Important Note: An article moved into the category will not be required to have this data filled in, however, the next time the article is edited, the data will need to be filled in or the article can not be saved.

Add a specific URL that you want the block title to link to. Leaving this blank will link to the Series Index page.

The display order determines the order in which the articles will appear on the series page as well as the order in which the article titles will appear within the series table of contents on article pages.

Tip: Using increments of 10 or 100 when setting the display order allow you add a new article between existing articles without having to adjust display orders of multiple existing articles.
The series {title} was reassigned to you.

Enter the URL of the article that you want to add to this series.

Important Note: Only visible state articles can be added to a series.

Important Note: Only staff members can add another member's article to a series.

If enabled, when creating a new article that has tags, those tags will also be applied to the newly created associated discussion thread.

Important Note: Only staff members can add another member's article to a another members series UNLESS it is a community series!
